title: Taylor Swift shares sneak preview of Cats original song and we’re already crying
text:
Taylor Swift has shared a first little preview into her new hit for the upcoming movie of Cats.

The star will be appearing in the musical, alongside the likes of Idris Elba, Rebel Wilson, and Jennifer Hudson, and has found herself collaborating with the living legend Andrew Lloyd Webber.

After announcing her new song, Beautiful Ghosts, with the musician, the 29-year-old has since revealed some of the track’s lyrics – and we’re already crying.

When appearing on Zane Lowe’s radio show, she said: ‘Andrew just sits at the piano and he starts playing this melody that I’ve never heard before. And I know it’s not in the original film of Cats.

‘I’m like, “This is the one and this is my moment.” There’s no top line. So, a top line on a song is the words and the melody that somebody sings.

‘So if you have a song stuck in your head, chances are you’re singing the top line.’

Taylor Swift shares sneak preview of Cats original song (Picture: Universal)

The Calm Down hitmaker continued: ‘What he has got is this beautiful instrumental piece. As soon as he starts playing it, I start singing the top line. I knew exactly what this character would say if she was going to sing a song. I knew where in the movie they were going to put her song.’

The pop star explained how she had planned for this moment, and started to gather data before her audition.

‘I knew that it would be after Memory,’ she went on: ‘I thought, wouldn’t it be interesting if you had this little young kitten reflect off of what she just heard and give sort of her counterpoint of view?

‘Because Memory is Grizabella singing about how she had all these beautiful, incredible moments in her past. She had these glittering occasions and she felt beautiful and she felt wanted and now she doesn’t feel that way anymore.

We’re already crying (Picture: Getty Images)

‘And I was just thinking, okay, so what if you’ve got this little kitten that’s been deserted and kind of tossed out by her owners and she’s had to wander around the streets of London wondering where she’s going to find a home. Wouldn’t she be thinking, “at least you had those amazing memories.”‘

Reciting some of the lyrics she has voiced to Lloyd Webber, Taylor revealed: ‘And the memories were lost long ago, but at least you have beautiful ghosts.’

She smirked: ‘Well, I appreciated it. Because I just wanted it to be, I wanted to get in the head of the character and think, if she was hearing somebody lamenting about wonderful, miraculous, majestic, incredible times, having this extraordinary life behind her.

‘I could see this young person thinking like, “What if I never have any of that in my whole life? What if that’s lost on me? What if I don’t get that ever? At least you have that to cling to.”

‘The first line is, “Follow me home if you dare to, I wouldn’t know where to lead you. Should I take chances when no one took chances on me?” And it goes, “So I watch from the dark, wait for my life to start, with no beauty in my memory.”’

Cats is released in cinemas on 20 December.
